conclusion: Analyze the effect of light source movement on shadow position and size.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage, positioned to the left of the birdcage.
Shadow B is cast by the glass object, positioned below and slightly to the left of the glass object.
Shadow C is cast by the drumstick, positioned directly below and slightly to the left of the drumstick.
Shadows will shift in the opposite direction of light source movement and potentially elongate.
Shadow A will move further to the left and may become larger due to the angle change.
Shadow B will move further to the left and may become larger due to the angle change.
Shadow C will move further to the left and may become larger due to the angle change.
Summarize: Shadows A, B, and C move further to the left and potentially become larger.
